meanings.sent1: She rewaxed her surfboard before heading out to catch some waves.
meanings.sent2: After the car wash, he rewaxed his car to keep it shiny and protected.
meanings.sent3: The candle maker accidentally rewaxed his own hands instead of the candles!
meanings.sent4: The old furniture looked rewaxed, as if it had been given a new lease on life.
meanings.sent5: The antique table gleamed as if rewaxed by a master craftsman.

meanings.definition: To cover or treat (something) with wax again
meanings.sent1: The skier rewaxed his skis to ensure a smooth glide down the slopes.
meanings.sent2: She rewaxed the thread before sewing to make it stronger and more durable.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally rewaxed the canvas, creating a unique texture for the painting.
meanings.sent4: The old boat was rewaxed, ready to sail smoothly on the glistening water.
meanings.sent5: The antique statue seemed rewaxed, preserving its beauty for generations to come.
